item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Thursday, September 5, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Porting systemd to musl libc-powered Linux (52 points | 16 comments)
2. Is Linux collapsing under its own weight? On Rust for Linux (22 points | 74 comments)
3. The Internet Archive just lost its appeal over ebook lending (19 points | 4 comments)
4. The Moral Implications of Being a Moderately Successful Computer Scientist and a Woman (20 points | no comments)
5. Async Rust can be a pleasure to work with (without `Send + Sync + 'static`) (67 points | 41 comments)
6. Announcing Rust 1.81.0 (15 points | 2 comments)
7. My most downvoted StackOverflow answer (13 points | 5 comments)
8. The Internet Archive Loses Its Appeal of a Major Copyright Case (20 points | 10 comments)
9. Intuiting Monty Hall (4 points | 10 comments)
10. Swift is a more convenient Rust (5 points | 2 comments)
11. Building a WoW server in Elixir (5 points | 3 comments)
12. Dynamicland (43 points | 15 comments)
13. QEMU version 9.1.0 released (10 points | 4 comments)
14. LazyFS: A FUSE Filesystem with an internal dedicated page cache, which can be used to simulate data loss on unsynced writes (11 points | no comments)
15. An Optimization That's Impossible in Rust (16 points | 2 comments)
16. Exercism has 2M users but no money in the bank (5 points | 1 comment)
17. Postgres Materialized Views from Parquet in S3 with Zero ETL (4 points | 1 comment)
18. TUI for lobste.rs website (38 points | 3 comments)
19. How we build forms in LiveView + LiveSvelte (1 points | no comments)
20. pdqselect: Pattern-Defeating QuickSelect for Go (3 points | no comments)
21. Twelve rules for job applications and interviews (18 points | 9 comments)
22. Giving C++ std::regex a C makeover (9 points | 7 comments)
23. Beyond Procedure Calls as Component Glue: Connectors Deserve Metaclass Status (4 points | no comments)
24. Clojure 1.12.0 is released (2 points | 1 comment)
25. You're allowed to be evil in performance code (2 points | no comments)
